## Overview

To start a multiplayer game for a local player, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/start()] method. TabletopKit syncs the current table state between all peers in the session, so update the table state before invoking this method.

After invoking the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/start()] method, the local player becomes the arbiter who ensures that TabletopKit applies actions in order for all players. To switch the arbiter role between players, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/becomeArbiter()] and [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/followArbiter(_:)] methods.

To join an existing game, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/join()] method, and to pass incoming messages to the game, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/processIncomingMessage(_:from:)] method.

To get all the people who join the session, not just the players, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/peers] property.

# TabletopNetworkSession

**Class**

An object that coordinates network-related tasks in multiplayer games.

## Declaration

```swift
class TabletopNetworkSession<Coordinator> where Coordinator : TabletopNetworkSessionCoordinator
```

## Overview

To start a multiplayer game for a local player, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/start()] method. TabletopKit syncs the current table state between all peers in the session, so update the table state before invoking this method.

After invoking the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/start()] method, the local player becomes the arbiter who ensures that TabletopKit applies actions in order for all players. To switch the arbiter role between players, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/becomeArbiter()] and [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/followArbiter(_:)] methods.

To join an existing game, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/join()] method, and to pass incoming messages to the game, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/processIncomingMessage(_:from:)] method.

To get all the people who join the session, not just the players, use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopNetworkSession/peers] property.

## Joining multiplayer games

- **start()**: Start a new multiplayer game, promoting the local state of the table to all connected peers
- **join()**: Join an existing game started between the connected peers
- **leave()**: Leave the current multiplayer game
- **terminate()**

## Changing the arbiter role between players

- **becomeArbiter()**
- **followArbiter(_:)**

## Managing network session peers

- **peers**: The set of peers known by the game
- **addPeer(_:)**: Notify the game that a new peer has connected
- **removePeer(_:)**: Notify the game that an existing peer disconnected
- **TabletopNetworkSession.Peer**

## Receiving messages from peers

- **processIncomingMessage(_:from:)**: Pass incoming messages from the reliable channel to the game.
- **processIncomingUnreliableMessage(_:from:)**: Pass incoming messages from the unreliable channel to the game.

## Multiplayer network session

- **TabletopNetworkSessionCoordinator**: A protocol for objects that manage network sessions between peers.
- **TabletopSendMessageResult**: The possible results of sending messages in a network session.
